data.job_description:
Applied Scientist, Artificial General Intelligence, AGI Information

Stellen-ID: 2970334 | Amazon Development Center Germany GmbH

We are looking for a passionate, talented and inventive Applied Scientist to develop industry-leading Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI) technology with Large Language Models (LLMs). In this role, you will innovate in the fastest-moving fields of current AI research, in particular developing state-of-the-art foundation models capable of processing a broad range of prompts and information in many languages.

If you are deeply familiar with Large Language Model development, natural language processing and machine learning, this may be the right opportunity for you. Our fast-paced environment requires a high degree of independence in making decisions and driving ambitious research agendas all the way to production. You will work with other science and engineering teams across AGI, as well as business stakeholders to maximize velocity and impact of your team's contributions.

Design and execute experiments to evaluate the performance of post-training algorithms and data, and iterate quickly to improve results.
• PhD, or a Master's degree and experience in CS, CE, ML or related field
• Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language
• Experience with deep learning and/or machine learning, post-training techniques for LLMs (SFT, DPO, PPO etc.), natural language processing.

Experience using Unix/Linux
• Experience in patents or publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals
• Experience in professional software development
• Hands-on experience in training and evaluating LLMs

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice () to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit for more information.

data.job_title: Entrepreneurial Team For Data-Mining/NLP/Quantitative Content Analysis needed for International Quantitative Content Analysis/NLP/Data-Mining
data.job_description: The aim of the company is to address various business problems related to Marketing (e.g., consumer analysis), Pricing, Competitor analysis etc. across various sources (e.g., social media) on an international scale via traditional means (e.g., sentiment analysis, dictionary building) but also to implement unique NLP approaches (machine-learning).

data.job_title: Mitgründer/-in im Bereich NLP/ML needed for Legal Tech Start-Up
data.job_description: - IT-Absolvent:in (Bachelor oder Master) bevorzugt mit Wohnsitz in Berlin- Ausgeprägte technische Expertise und/oder weitergehende Einarbeitungsbereitschaft in Bereichen wie ML (Entity Recognition, Federated und Deep Learning), NLP, Computer Vision (OCR) und/oder Data Science jeweils mit Bezug zu Textverarbeitung und Auswertung - Berufserfahrung ist ein Plus- Fähigkeit, schwierige Fragen/Informationen aus der Business-Perspektive zu verstehen und in Software-Features umzusetzen- Fähigkeit, sich vorzustellen, wie technisches Wissen außerhalb der akademischen Welt angewandt werden kann mit einem Fokus auf technische Innovation

There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.

We’re searching for a talented Principal Researcher to join us for our efforts building out the Snowflake platform with cognitive capabilities. Our team at Snowflake has responsibility for moving boundaries of NLP space to SOTA levels and coming up with new solutions in cognitive space. As our team is growing rapidly to keep up with this key responsibility alongside Snowflake’s immense growth, we need additional talent to help lead the change.

You will get to be a technology thought leader, evangelize new, cutting-edge technologies and solve complex problems.

AS PRINCIPAL RESEARCH YOU WILL:
• Build products and services that are at the heart of research
• Participate in decision-making processes and set new courses for our research projects
• Collaborate with engineers and researchers across teams to help deliver cross-functional initiatives
• Think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often ambiguous problems.
• Participate in all stages of developing new LLM-based solutions in the domain of unstructured data processing.
• Work closely with other research, engineering, and product management to understand and shape the short and long-term product development strategy.
• Serve as a mentor to less experienced researchers, engineers, and product managers.
• Answer questions from the executive team for board reporting, publications, and industry reports.

IDEAL PRINCIPAL RESEARCH WILL HAVE:
• 18+ years of industry or academia experience in NLP and unstructured data research and commercialization
• Expert level knowledge working with Python and Deep Learning libraries such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
• Familiar with recent advances in NLP/CV with a deep understanding of the basic classes of ML/DL algorithms (also the underlying assumptions).
• Prior exposure to best practices in the software development lifecycle, and a commitment to implementing these practices appropriately in the context.
• High levels of curiosity and eager enthusiasm for open-ended problems. Experience and interest in problem formulation based on relatively abstract information.
• Ability to articulate results and complex concepts to leadership.
• Must be able to produce solutions independently in an organized manner, work in a team and also be able to lead a team when required.
• Ph,D. in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or in related fields will be considered as a strong asset.
• A proven track record in top-tier conferences from AI/NLP domain will be a strong asset.

Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Natural Language Processing Engineer

We are seeking a talented Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer to join our AI Research and Development team. As an NLP Engineer, you will play a key role in developing cutting-edge algorithms and models to enhance our AI technology.

Analytics & AI Engineer
Your Tasks
• Design and maintain scalable data models & pipelines.
• Optimize query performance and data processing efficiency.
• Automate recurring business data workflows and reporting processes.
• Develop intuitive dashboards and insightful reports to empower internal teams.
• Build GenAI systems in production, including LLMs, embeddings, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
• Architect end-to-end AI solutions — from data collection to model deployment and monitoring.
• Collaborate closely with product, software development, and business teams to integrate and enhance AI-driven solutions.
Your Profile
• You have 3+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering or AI engineering.
• Strong proficiency in Python and SQL with expertise in building and optimizing ETL/ELT pipelines.
• Solid experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and data warehouses (Redshift, BigQuery).
• Skilled in data orchestration and modeling tools (Airflow, dbt).
• Hands-on experience developing production-ready generative AI solutions (e.g., LLMs, embeddings, RAG, chatbots) using tools like OpenAI, Hugging Face, or Claude.
• Entrepreneurial and independent, with strong collaboration and communication skills across diverse teams.
About us

We Are Era is the first pan-European studio and talent agency with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Cologne, Paris, Milan and Stockholm. Our vision? Shaping the zeitgeist in an era of movements - and with success: our productions and campaigns for broadcasters, brands and NGOs have won multiple awards. We create stories with impact and attitude, developed and told by and for people all over Europe. Our projects range from TV productions and fictional series to innovative formats on social video platforms such as YouTube, Instagram, Twitch and TikTok. We develop social influencers and artists into cross-platform personality brands that are now found on social media, on TV, in podcasts, on the big screen or in the music charts. Our international team of 250 speaks all languages - from mainstream to subculture, from the Friday For Future movement to K-pop culture. Together, we offer our partners the fast-lane ticket to every community in Europe. Are you ready to shape the zeitgeist with us? Join the Movement!

data.job_title: AI Systems Engineer: Large Language Model Specialist
data.job_description:
We are seeking a talented AI Engineer to join our growing Data Science team.

This role will involve developing and implementing advanced AI systems, working with large language models, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and growth.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science, NLP, and programming, with experience in deploying and monitoring machine learning systems in production.

Additionally, they will possess excellent communication skills, a passion for knowledge sharing and mentoring, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
About the Role
• Develop and implement advanced AI systems using large language models
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and growth
• Work on exciting projects and opportunities to experiment
• Deploy and monitor machine learning systems in production

Bonus skills include experience in healthcare or nutrition, German language skills, and expertise in MLOps and GitOps workflows.
Requirements
• 2–3 years industry experience
• Advanced knowledge in data science, information retrieval & extraction, natural language processing (NLP)
• Experience building, training, testing, evaluating (scoring) large language model (LLM) solutions
• Advanced understanding of a programming language (preferably Python)
• Good basic knowledge in data structures & algorithms
• Good communication skills in English

We offer a competitive salary, healthy work-life balance, personal growth and further training, and an international and diverse team.

If you think you have what it takes to fulfill this role but don't necessarily fit every single point of the job description, please get in touch anyway. We'd love to talk to you and find out if you're a good fit.

Unlock the Power of AI

We are seeking a skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. As a key member, you will play a central role in defining and building our ML platform, enabling cutting-edge AI agents that excel at discovering and organizing knowledge.

Your primary focus will be on building text-based generative AI applications end-to-end with a strong emphasis on benchmarking and experimentation with models, prompts, and system design. Additionally, you will have ample opportunities to dive deeper into topics such as synthetic data generation, model distillation, training embedding models for retrieval, etc.

To succeed in this role, you must possess a strong track record working on applied ML, preferably with experience in the life sciences. Your work will help lay the foundation for a new way of working with data, and we encourage you to apply if you are passionate about applying AI to real-world problems and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

The ideal candidate will have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a similar quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience. A proven experience in implementing practical ML algorithms and scaling them to millions of datapoints is also essential. You should be familiar with at least one ML framework such as PyTorch, JAX, TensorFlow, or similar, and have 3+ years of experience developing in Python.

We offer a competitive salary tailored to your experience and role level, equity stock options, generous paid time off, on-site work arrangements with flexibility, learning and development budget, and regular team retreats. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Some of the skills and qualifications we look for include:
• A Master's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a similar quantitative field — or equivalent practical experience.
• Proven experience implementing practical ML algorithms and scaling them to millions of datapoints.
• 3+ years of experience developing in Python.
• Familiarity with at least one ML framework such as PyTorch, JAX, TensorFlow, or similar.
• Bonus: Experience applying AI to the life sciences or related fields.
